message_1: Simplify the logarithmic expression log(base 3) 27 - log(base 3) 9.
message_2:
To simplify the logarithmic expression log(base 3) 27 - log(base 3) 9, we can use the logarithmic property:

log(base b) a - log(base b) c = log(base b) (a/c)

Applying this property, we get:

log(base 3) 27 - log(base 3) 9 = log(base 3) (27/9)

Now, we can simplify the fraction inside the logarithm:

27/9 = 3

So, the expression becomes:

log(base 3) 3

Since 3 is the base of the logarithm and 3^1 = 3, the expression simplifies to:

1

Therefore, log(base 3) 27 - log(base 3) 9 = 1.
